content: I have been to Mumbai many times already & stayed at various places,  from a Home stay to a 5 Star. hotel_name: í˜¸í…” í´ë¦¬í”„í„´ (Hotel cliffton)
title: Good.â€
content:
Pros,
1. Located in the heart of the city.
2. Very close (almost besides) to the Jogeshwari (W) station and with just a few minutes walk.
3. Food quality is ok. Not too spicy not too light.
4. In premises car parking.
5. Wardrobe with locker, hangers
6. Ironing table with iron.
7. Electric tea/coffee kitley.
8. Small fridge.
9. Clean sanitary with hot and cold water availability.
10. Bottled and RO both options available.
11. Good pantry/hotel/buffet facilities available on the 7th floor named Seagate.
13. DND and Clean Room facilities available in the form of buttons in the rooms itself.
14. Digital Smart Card for wireless entry for the door.
15. Room service, front desk and food service is pretty quick and cooperative.
16. Faulty lights were replaced immediately upon bringing to the front desk notice.

Cons,
1. Rooms are comparatively smaller as compared to the price tag.
2. Nearby area is not that great.
3. View from the hotel is not that great.
4. No string option available for drying the clothes.
5. No chair, no center table available to eat the dinner in the room. Either you have to eat your food on the bed or on the floor.
6. Only transparent window available , no option to open the windows.
7. Basement parking is stinky and not that clean and not painted.

content: Close to Jogeshwari railway station, with friendly and responsive staff. Rooms are clean, though a bit dated, and have ample space. The hotel offers free parking. The room service is also good and delivers food into the room from in-house restaurant within 20 mins. There is a small flight of stairs you need to carry your luggage to reach the reception. I was helped on my way in but not on my way out. I did not notice a lift or slope and it might be challenging for people who need wheelchair access.

hotel_name: ë‹ˆë€íƒ€ íŠ¸ëœì§“ í˜¸í…” ë­„ë°”ì´ ì—ì–´í¬íŠ¸ (Niranta Transit Hotel Mumbai Airport)
title: A Comfortable and Convenient Stay at the Airportâ€
content:
Our recent family trip involved a long layover at Mumbai airport, and to make the most of our time and ensure everyone was well-rested, we decided to book a stay at the Airport Transit Hotel. It turned out to be a smart decision.

Location and Accessibility: 

It's literally a stone's throw away from the airport terminal 2. Its a short walk from Baggage collection point to the hotel. If you wish to go out to the city you can collect a pass from the hotel to leave the airport and then return.

Check-in/Check-Out and Service: 

The check-in & checkout process was smooth & fast. The staff was responsive to the requests.

Room Comfort & Amenities: 

I had booked a Double comfort room, it was a bit small but ok for 2 Adults & 2 Kids (under 10). The room was clean and beds were cozy. The only downside was the occasional noise from the hallway and next rooms can be disturbing for light sleepers. The restaurant has 24/7 room service and the food court in the Airport (Parking Level6 or P6) has multiple options ranging from ShivSagar, KFC, tibbs frankie etc.

Value for Money: 

While the convenience of the Airport Transit Hotel is undeniable, it does come at a slightly higher price point compared to nearby hotels outside the airport. However, for the comfort and peace of mind it provided during our layover, we found it to be a worthwhile investment.

Overall Experience: 

Our stay at the Airport Niranta Transit Hotel was a pleasant and convenient experience.We would certainly consider staying here again for future layovers.

title: We had a long layover after a hectic trip and this hotel gave us the re-charge that we needed. â€
content: The hotel is located in the  2nd floor of the Mumbai airport international terminal. You don't need an Indian Visa to stay at the hotel. The rooms were spotlessly clean, sleep quality was great and the staff was friendly and efficient. I would highly recommend staying here instead of a lounge if you have a long lay over. The food court of the airport is located on the ground floor and offers a. variety of local and international food and drinks. Duty free shopping is next to the food court.

hotel_name: ë‹ˆë€íƒ€ íŠ¸ëœì§“ í˜¸í…” ë­„ë°”ì´ ì—ì–´í¬íŠ¸ (Niranta Transit Hotel Mumbai Airport)
title: A Comfortable and Convenient Stay at the Airportâ€
content:
Our recent family trip involved a long layover at Mumbai airport, and to make the most of our time and ensure everyone was well-rested, we decided to book a stay at the Airport Transit Hotel. It turned out to be a smart decision.

Location and Accessibility: 

It's literally a stone's throw away from the airport terminal 2. Its a short walk from Baggage collection point to the hotel. If you wish to go out to the city you can collect a pass from the hotel to leave the airport and then return.

Check-in/Check-Out and Service: 

The check-in & checkout process was smooth & fast. The staff was responsive to the requests.

Room Comfort & Amenities: 

I had booked a Double comfort room, it was a bit small but ok for 2 Adults & 2 Kids (under 10). The room was clean and beds were cozy. The only downside was the occasional noise from the hallway and next rooms can be disturbing for light sleepers. The restaurant has 24/7 room service and the food court in the Airport (Parking Level6 or P6) has multiple options ranging from ShivSagar, KFC, tibbs frankie etc.

Value for Money: 

While the convenience of the Airport Transit Hotel is undeniable, it does come at a slightly higher price point compared to nearby hotels outside the airport. However, for the comfort and peace of mind it provided during our layover, we found it to be a worthwhile investment.

Overall Experience: 

Our stay at the Airport Niranta Transit Hotel was a pleasant and convenient experience.We would certainly consider staying here again for future layovers.

title: Poor value for money â€
content:
Had booked 2 rooms- one for my in-lawns and one for my family.
Except for the location, this place has nothing more to offer.
 Rooms small and claustrophobic. No windows, no storage facilities. A/C was not working in my room- room temperature never came below 25.5*C - felt like a sauna. In spite of calling the reception few times, no one came to look initially. By the time I went personally to get someone, my kids and wife,  exhausted by travel, weâ€™re asleep. The manager then said that A/C cannot be fixed so offered change of room. This was almost midnight and we were supposed  to get up at 3:30 next morning to catch our international flight. Repacking, waking up kids and going to another room was out of question. We didnâ€™t have an option but to sleep in the same room to at least get few hours rest.
Other problems- leaking toilet water pipe, shower drainage not working- water collecting like a pool for a long time during shower. 
Even food downstairs in their restaurant was overpriced and poor quality. The worst chicken malai kabab Iâ€™ve ever had.
Wouldnâ€™t recommend this to anyone.
I would want compensation as the facilities were way below par.

title: Terrible hotelâ€
content:
Had a TERRIBLE experience. First, I asked for pick-up from Terminal 1, the far Domastic Terminal, to the hotel. No one bothered to reply, and I stood there hoping that someone would arrive... no one came. when I arrived the hotel on my own, I was told that they don't have shuttle services because taxis arent allowed to stop near the hotel - A. You could  email this answer to me instead of ignoring. B. This is a disappointing answer, given that you are several floors below the AIRPORT - a taxi-infested place.)
Needless to say I didn't hear a single apology for the disgraceful service.
I went in for a shower. Within 5 minutes, and with shampoo on my hair, the water turned ice cold. I rang the reception, and answered that they have a 5 minutes limit to the hot water, and that I would have to wait a few minutes if I want hot water. WHAT?!?
I  asked to leave the hotel and cancel my payment. The manager didn't agree. I felt locked.
plus, I vomited 4 hours after eating their breakfast.
AWFUL

Very unprofessionnal

title: Excellent location but a bit pricey for Indiaâ€
content:
Positives:This hotel is located within the International airport so if you have a connecting flight from the International or domestic terminal the following day, it is an excellent choice.  The room was clean and an ok size.
Negatives: The room was very cold, and the heating did not work.  Our room was opposite the massage treatment room, so it was a bit noisy with people coming and going.  Avoid this room if possible

title: Staff woke me at 4 am when I got to sleep few mins asleepâ€
content:
Subject: Urgent Matter - Interruption at 4 AM

Dear [Recipient's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I would like to bring to your attention an issue that occurred earlier this morning.

At approximately 4 AM, I had just managed to get a few minutes of sleep after a long day when a staff member unexpectedly woke me. This interruption was both unexpected and distressing, as I was in need of rest at that time.

I believe that clear communication and mutual understanding are crucial within our organization, and I wanted to address this matter promptly.

hotel_name: ë‹ˆë€íƒ€ íŠ¸ëœì§“ í˜¸í…” ë­„ë°”ì´ ì—ì–´í¬íŠ¸ (Niranta Transit Hotel Mumbai Airport)
title: Nice hotel, hard to navigate toâ€
content: If you are getting to this hotel from outside of the airport, chances are the driver hasnâ€™t heard about it and doesnâ€™t know where to go, causing a lot of confusion. There is no signage for the hotel on the outside as well. The entrance location is actually on P4. It is hard to come in and out of the building cause of airport security but they do the best they can with entrance passes. Itâ€™s best to call them once you arrive so they can escort you in. I only chose this hotel because I was travelling with three seniors who are slow and thought it would be convenient to just take the elevator up to departures to leave, which it was. But I donâ€™t think it was worth the hassle and stress of trying to find the hotel in the first place. The staff was extremely helpful and kind. Breakfast is not free.

hotel_name: ë‹ˆë€íƒ€ íŠ¸ëœì§“ í˜¸í…” ë­„ë°”ì´ ì—ì–´í¬íŠ¸ (Niranta Transit Hotel Mumbai Airport)
title: Covenienceâ€
content: Great for overnight stay, specially for people travelling from other smaller cities to take early morning international flights from Mumbai. Its very close to international departure so hassle free.

hotel_name: ë‹ˆë€íƒ€ íŠ¸ëœì§“ í˜¸í…” ë­„ë°”ì´ ì—ì–´í¬íŠ¸ (Niranta Transit Hotel Mumbai Airport)
title: Just what was neededâ€
content: Had to check out of our downtown hotel at 2pm and had a 4 am flight.  This hotel was located right in the international terminal.  To access the hotel you will need your ticket and I printed off our boarding pass.  Go to the information desk and ask them to call the hotel.  A representative arrived in 10 minutes and escorted us to the hotel.  It took us about 45 minutes to figure this out.  The room while small was very clean.  There is an on site restaurant which was actually very good.  An excellent choice for an airport  hotel.  In the early morning we were act the airline check in counter within 15 minutes.

I book luxury  room, paid extra including airport transfer.

We paud extra/difference to get upgraded to Luzury room and the AC on the room was not working- in addition the room was not cleaned properly, the refirgerator was not working properly, no proper toiletries for a 3star and the towels were porbably 15yrs old.

Better to spend 1000-2000 rupees extra and stay in decent hotels nearby.

On November 7, 2019, 14 people checked in.
Airport Pick-up Service Perfect!

If I use Delhi Airport, I'll check in again.

hotel_name: ë˜ë””ìŠ¨ ë¸”ë£¨ ìì´í‘¸ë¥´ (Radisson Blu Jaipur)
title: Moderately pleasant stay but with hiccupsâ€
content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my family (with a very young kid) . I had booked 2 rooms. Firstly, it's quite annoying that the check-in time is 3pm. But even if I let that pass (it is pretty common I guess) there were things that annoyed me. We reached the hotel at 3.20 and were still made to wait for a good 20 minutes or so to be given the room key. Even then we got just 1 room, the person at the reception told us that they'd send the key to our second room in 5 mins. That did not happen. After getting to our room and spending another 30 mins I had to go to the reception and ask for the key to my second room. I asked the reason for the delay and the person told me that a few guests turned up before 3pm and the hotel was busy allocating rooms to them. This reply did not go down well with me. I mean I appreciate them accommodating guests with early check in but what about the others who come on time or a little later? Why do we have to suffer? And obviously I had pre-booked my rooms, in which case, why did it take the hotel so much time to give those to me? Finally after getting the second room key, I found that slippers were missing, and the magnifying mirror was wobbly. I mean one shouldn't have to go through these things, especially in a 5 star hotel. What am I then paying you the exorbitant price for if this is the kind of service I get? So, I'm disappointed at my stay here, although other things were fine.

hotel_name: ë˜ë””ìŠ¨ ë¸”ë£¨ ìì´í‘¸ë¥´ (Radisson Blu Jaipur)
title: Pathetic hospitality â€
content: Have been traveling constantly and had seen good reviews hence booked Radisson Blu Jaipur. We got an early check in and that was the only good thing. Reception staff needs to be called repeatedly to get anything done. We had an early morning flight and hence had called up the in room dining to which nobody responded. 4 times different people at the reception answered and assured the staff would come up to take the order but not a soul turned up. Charging points were faulty and apparently as per the person in charge the guest shud ask for a multiple pin plug if you want to access the charging point. One of the most pathetic hospitality ever seen from the staff. Disappointed to the core. Not comparing but had booked Mariott once and the staff was so so good that they ensured there was an airport drop + the chef sent his regards and love in the form of morning breakfast that too without any additional charges. Now that's hospitality expected from a brand like Radisson, but this was definitely not good. Except for the fact that it's very close to the airport I didn't find any merit much.

title: Donâ€™t be fooled by fancy bathtubs!  Terrible hotel. â€
content:
Arrived at hotel to a lukewarm reception staff. Went to room to find that it was previously occupied by a person with long black hair (I am a blond). Open water bottles and shampoo bottles were on the counters. Obviously the room was previously occupied and not cleaned. Internet did not work at all.
The staff seemed like they were doing you a favor by helping you in any way. I donâ€™t mean a few staff, I mean not one of the many I had contact with during my stay. 
I stayed in many hotels while in India. All of them with very nice and helpful staff. This was the worst hotel by far. I travel a lot and this was probably one of my worst ever. Stay away!

hotel_name: ë˜ë””ìŠ¨ ë¸”ë£¨ ìì´í‘¸ë¥´ (Radisson Blu Jaipur)
title: Check twice before pickingâ€
content:
Brand definitely matters and that the only reason i booked Radisson for my family visit.
We were 2 adult and 2 kids (1 is 13 and other one 6 ), thus though i would have gone with single room i took 2 just to make sure that we should not have issues.
I have requested for a early check in and king bed with adjacent rooms
When we landed , the reservation vs tie front desk were not in sync; i had to wait and make them understand and then it worked post may be 30mins of delay.
rooms were good, clean 
not too much options with food though they offered buffet but it was not worth .
my wife tried using the SPA, with a lot of calls and follow up she got an appointment for 1230pm (She was behind them from 930 am) only 1 person working other did not turned up.. thus has to cancel the same.
supplies were limited and did not refilled the next day.

Anyway to cut it short i guess it is worth to visit hotels like The Fern which is just 50mtrs from there and has good facilities .
will try to skipp Radisson going forward.

title: Noisy rooms, dirty swimming pool, broken airconditioning.â€
content:
Noisy room:  I was located in the fifth floor of the hotel facing the front. i could literally hear the traffic outside it was terrible not to mention the party going on the top floor it was terrible.

Broken Aircon:  The aircon broke down the front desk never transfered me to another room. i had to wait for engineering to come in and out for 2 hours figuring out how to fix the aircon.

Dirty pool:  ok so the pool is probably 4.5 to 5 feet deep and you cant see the floor anymore thats how dirty the water is. with lots of dove feathers and bird poop everywhere not to mention not a single lounger was on set up. 

the only positive thing about this place is the crew. they where all very nice and attentive.

title: Worst Hotel Worst Staff Worst Experienceâ€
content:
Worst Experience! Never ever book this hotel. It's a loss of your money... 
The staff over here is not cooperative they don't know how to talk to customers.

hotel_name: ë˜ë””ìŠ¨ ë¸”ë£¨ ìì´í‘¸ë¥´ (Radisson Blu Jaipur)
title: Overworked Retarded Hotel near Jaipur Airportâ€
content: No drinking water in the room .. to compensate probably, the Toilet Drain Water is let into the room, which is not attended to despite several reminders - the maintenance crew come and make an eyewash of mopping the water, without locating the fault at all, finally after you create a lot of noise, you are made to shift to another room around 0100 in the middle of the night, when you have to catch a flight at 0500 in the morning, depriving you of sleep totally ; most favourite TV channels don't work, since the hotel has chosen only the "FREE TO AIR" channels refusing to pay for entertainment of the guests ; the TV screen doesn't go OFF totally, with the signal lights glaring into the night, bang in front of the bed and into your eyes, depriving you of whatever little sleep you are entitled to ; no hand towels in the room ; paid for breakfast is not served, since you are leaving before the breakfast time of 0730 to avoid missing the delayed flight.  Only one cordial and apologetic staffer - Rahul Singh Rajput - in the middle of the night, without any support staff, leaves one only to pity the plight of the guests, who fall prey to the name of Radisson

hotel_name: ë˜ë””ìŠ¨ ë¸”ë£¨ ìì´í‘¸ë¥´ (Radisson Blu Jaipur)
title: Did not enjoy my Stayâ€
content: My room was located on the 6th floor near the spa and did not like the smell of the oils. The airconditoner was not working and we bascially uncomfortable during our stay. The hot water was not working and it took about 6 hrs until 12 midnight for it to be repaired. The location is not good and is too far away form shopping areas and restuarants. This hotel may suit business travellers only. The Manager was not prepared to offer me a reduction in costs or refund due to the inconvenience experienced. The cost of food and alcohol and taxes at the hotel are very expensive when compared to international rates.

title: Very patheticâ€
content:
Very pathetic indeed, staff present there is just sinking the same of hotel. at the time of check in they had took 3 attempts to give me the right room, they send me to unclean room twice and I had to come back to lobby 3 times to complain. 
They were slow in bringing luggage in room. 
Their in room dining staff has no freaking idea about the menu or even no idea about what they are delivering to my room.
The quantity of their in room dining items changes every day ( for eg they dont have a freaking idea how many pc 2 potion of chapati should be send over), I ordered 4 times and got different no of pcs all the time. 
The check out too was extremely slow, i called them thrice for luggage pick up and ultimately had to go downstairs and yell at them to get my luggage off the room and check out.
